title: Rapunzel
sentence: The house overlooked a vast  dark forest and at the edge of the forest lived an enchantress  who had great power and was feared by everyone in the kingdom  ~newline~ The enchantress had a beautiful garden  full of sweet smelling flowers and herbs  ~newline~ The wife wished that she could have a beautiful  sweet smelling garden just like the enchantress  ~newline~ But there was no way the nasty enchantress would ever share the delicious rampion with her  ~newline~ Please  ask the enchantress if she would give me some   The woodcutter shook his head and laughed  ~newline~  I hear the last person who went to see the enchantress was turned into a toad  ~newline~ The enchantress will never spot that some of it has gone missing   and I will be able to make us a delicious supper   The woodcutter s belly rumbled at the thought  ~newline~ He was frightened of the enchantress and her great power  but perhaps if he stole the rampion at night no one would notice  ~newline~ He dropped the rampion and turned to see the enchantress watching him  her arms folded across her chest  ~newline~ Please  forgive me   The enchantress nodded  her scowl turning to a sly smile  ~newline~  Yes   snapped the enchantress  ~newline~ He just wanted to get as far away from the scary enchantress as he could  ~newline~ Keeping to her bargain  the enchantress came to the house and took the baby away  ~newline~ She lived in the house on the edge of the forest  with only the enchantress for company  ~newline~ The enchantress was angry  and took her deep into the forest instead  ~newline~ title: Rapunzel
sentence: There  Rapunzel was shut away in a tall dark tower that had neither stairs nor door   just a narrow little window for Rapunzel to look out of  ~newline~ At its centre was the tall stone tower  ~newline~ The Prince looked for a door to enter the tower  but there was nothing   just cold  dark stone  ~newline~ Scratching his head  he backed away from the tower  ~newline~ The witch climbed up to her and disappeared into the tower  ~newline~  So that is how I will reach my heart s desire   Once the enchantress had vanished into the forest  he walked up to the tower and called   Rapunzel  Rapunzel  let down your hair   Immediately the hair was lowered  ~newline~ With a smile  the Prince climbed the tower  ~newline~  Please let me take you far away from this horrible tower  ~newline~  How will I ever get down from this tower   sobbed Rapunzel  ~newline~ When it is ready I will be able to climb down from this horrible tower  ~newline~ Angrily  she marched up to Rapunzel s tower and shrieked at the top of her voice   Rapunzel  Rapunzel  let down your hair   Too afraid to do otherwise  Rapunzel lowered her plaited hair  ~newline~ The enchantress climbed up   and when she reached the tower s room  she cut off Rapunzel s hair with a swish of her knife  ~newline~  Now I will teach that love sick prince a lesson   At dawn the next morning  the Prince arrived at the tower with a bundle of silk  ~newline~ Eagerly  the Prince clambered up to the tower window  ~newline~  My love has gone  and now I have nothing to live for   With a cry of despair  he threw himself from the tower window  ~newline~  Dear Prince  you should look before you leap   With a click of her fingers  a tangled wall of thorns sprang up around the base of the tower

sentence: The house overlooked a vast  dark forest and at the edge of the forest lived an enchantress  who had great power and was feared by everyone in the kingdom  ~newline~ There  Rapunzel was shut away in a tall dark tower that had neither stairs nor door   just a narrow little window for Rapunzel to look out of  ~newline~ He dismounted and led his horse between the dark trees  ~newline~ The Prince looked for a door to enter the tower  but there was nothing   just cold  dark stone  ~newline~ It led him to a cool  dark cave where Rapunzel was waiting

sentence: www scholastic co uk http   www scholastic co uk  Fairytale Kingdom The Story of Rapunzel Once upon a time there was a woodcutter and his wife  who lived in a small house high on a hill  ~newline~ The woodcutter s wife would often stand on the hill and look down at the garden with envy  ~newline~ Nothing would grow on the hill where she lived   the earth was hard and stony  ~newline~ Nothing will grow on our hard  stony hill  ~newline~ She often looked out of her window and wondered who lived in the small house  perched on the hill
